intro: Gagea foliosa var. nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra gagea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in open woodlands and meadows. It is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in the Sierra Nevada range. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine and subalpine ecosystems.
